title: Paternity leave take-up in S’pore rises to 56% in 2023, experts hope for further boost after extension
content: The take-up rate for Government-paid paternity leave rose from 53 per cent in 2022 to 56 per cent in 2023.

title: Fewer marriages and births in Singapore in 2024; greater stability for later cohorts
content: There were 26,328 marriages in 2024, down from 28,310 in 2023 and 29,389 in 2022.

title: Jail for man who conducted surveillance of warehouse used by HSA to store seized vapes worth $6.5m
content: He was sentenced to one year, one month and six weeks’ jail for offences including obstructing the course of justice.

title: More nurses to anchor care in community settings as Singapore’s population ages
content: 141 nurses received the Nurses' Merit Award in 2025

title: Eligible S’poreans to get up to $850 in GSTV cash, up to $450 in MediSave top-ups in August
content: Eligible recipients will receive their cash payments via PayNow from Aug 6, and MediSave top-ups from Aug 11.

title: Four golf courses to close by 2035, leaving Singapore with 12 courses
content: The first of the four courses to close is the public nine-hole Mandai Executive Golf Course.

title: $1.46b nickel scam: Ng Yu Zhi opts to remain silent after judge calls for his defence
content: The judge said if he chooses to remain silent, the court may draw an adverse inference against him.

title: Van driver dies after collision with truck in Seletar
content: SCDF said the victim was pronounced dead at the scene.

title: Ex-massage therapist gets 4 months’ jail for teaching doctrine contrary to Islamic laws
content: Mohd Razif Radi was never an Islamic teacher under the Asatizah Recognition Scheme.

title: New SkillsFuture requirements from April 2026 to mandate regular training for adult educators
content: This will ensure they continue to upgrade, and keep up with industry developments and new training methods.

title: Construction starts on Cross Island Line Phase 2; 6 MRT stations in S’pore’s west ready by 2032
content: Studies for the third phase are almost done, with more details expected in end-2025.

title: Smart sensors used in study to detect cognitive decline in seniors who live alone
content: The technology could help more seniors to age better and remain for longer in the community.

title: More students in Singapore juggle studying and working to support their families
content: For some students, working part-time is a choice they make to help supplement their family’s income.

title: MPs should not ask questions to ‘clock numbers’; focus should be improving S’poreans’ lives: Seah Kian Peng
content: What is also important is the quality of the debate, he said.

title: Sequencing and standards: Indranee on role of Leader of the House
content: The aim is to ensure Parliament's work is well-fitted and can be completed in the allotted time, she said.

title: askST Jobs: Facing intrusive demands from your employer? Here’s what you can do
content: Employees should check their employment contracts and speak to HR before escalating the issue.

title: Life After... blazing biomedical research trail in S’pore: Renowned scientist breaks new ground at 59
content: Prof Jackie Ying is helping to advance Saudi Arabia’s biomedical scene, as she did for Singapore many years ago.

title: Losing her dad a month into poly, she powered through work shifts and studies to support her family
content: Amillie Chan was ready to quit school after a year, but her lecturer and mentor helped her stay the course.

title: Changkat Primary School turns 2,000 old uniforms into new creations for 60th anniversary
content: Parents, pupils and volunteers worked together to upcycle the uniforms into about 1,400 gifts.

title: NUS College draws 10,000 applications for 400 places, showing strong liberal arts interest
content: More than 30 of the incoming students for the new academic year are from the local polytechnics.

title: Enduring presence of vernacular media like Tamil Murasu in Singapore not by chance: Josephine Teo
content: She was speaking at a dinner to mark the Tamil daily’s 90th anniversary.

title: Minor Issues: What needs to be done to get more daughters into Stem careers
content: The barriers to women are real: lack of mentorship, unequal pay and outdated ideas of gender roles.

title: Overlooked ‘glass child’, the sibling of a special-needs kid
content: Such a child may be overlooked because the parents are focused on the offspring with special needs.

title: Meet the CAAS officer who helmed revision of building height limits near airports across the world

title: First BTO project in Sembawang North to be offered in July HDB launch

title: How soya sauce could help treat cancer

title: His world crashed when he got F9 in O-level Tamil but PropNex co-founder Ismail Gafoor beat the odds
